Class GameManager

java.lang.Object
domain.GameManager
public class GameManager extends Object
The GameManager class is responsible for managing the game's state, resources, and interactions in the Player vs Player mode. It is implemented as a singleton, allowing only one instance to be used throughout the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameManager

      public GameManager(int initialSunPoints, int initialBrainPoints, int initialTime)
      Constructs a GameManager instance with specified initial resources and time.
      Parameters:
      initialSunPoints - the initial amount of sun points available for the game
      initialBrainPoints - the initial amount of brain points available for the game
      initialTime - the initial game time in seconds

  • Method Details

    • setGame

      public void setGame(Game game)
      Sets the current game instance for the GameManager.
      Parameters:
      game - the Game object to be set as the current game

    • getInstance

      public static GameManager getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the GameManager. If the instance does not already exist, it initializes a new GameManager with default values for sun points, brain points, and game time.
      Returns:
      the single instance of GameManager

    • setGameTime

      public void setGameTime(int gameTime)
      Sets the game time to the specified value.
      Parameters:
      gameTime - the new game time in seconds

    • placePlant

      public boolean placePlant(Plant plant, int row, int col)
      Attempts to place a plant on the game board at the specified position. It first checks if there are enough sun points available to pay for the plant's cost. If successful, it deducts the plant's sun cost from the total sun points, updates the sun points display, and places the plant on the board.
      Parameters:
      plant - the plant to be placed
      row - the row index where the plant should be placed
      col - the column index where the plant should be placed
      Returns:
      true if the plant was successfully placed, false otherwise

    • placeZombie

      public boolean placeZombie(Zombies zombie, int row, int col)
      Attempts to place a zombie on the game board at the specified row. This method checks if the player has enough brain points to cover the cost of the zombie. If there are sufficient brain points and the zombie can be successfully placed on the board, the cost is deducted from the player's brain points.
      Parameters:
      zombie - the zombie to be placed
      row - the row index where the zombie should be placed
      col - the column index, which is considered in this method
      Returns:
      true if the zombie was successfully placed; false if there are not enough brain points or if the placement on the board was unsuccessful

    • updateGame

      public void updateGame()
      Updates the game state by moving zombies on the board and checking for game victory conditions.
      • Calls the moveZombies method on the game board to advance the position of zombies.
      • If there are no zombies remaining on the board, the player wins the game.

    • getSunPoints

      public int getSunPoints()
      Returns the current amount of sun points available in the game.
      Returns:
      the number of sun points

    • collectSun

      public void collectSun(int amount)
      Increases the total amount of sun points by the specified amount. This method also updates the sun points label in the current game interface.
      Parameters:
      amount - the number of sun points to be added

    • getBrainPointsPoints

      public int getBrainPointsPoints()
      Returns the current amount of brain points available in the game.
      Returns:
      the number of brain points

    • collectBrain

      public void collectBrain(int amount)
      Increases the total amount of brain points by the specified amount. This method also updates the sun points label in the current game interface, if a game is present.
      Parameters:
      amount - the number of brain points to be added

    • getGameTime

      public int getGameTime()
      Returns the current game time in seconds.
      Returns:
      the current game time

    • save

      public void save(File file) throws POOBvsZOMBIESException
      Saves the current game state to the specified file. The game state is serialized and written to the file.
      Parameters:
      file - the destination file to which the game state will be saved
      Throws:
      POOBvsZOMBIESException - if an error occurs during the file writing or serialization process

    • open

      public static GameManager open(File file) throws POOBvsZOMBIESException
      Opens a saved game state from the specified file and loads it into the game manager. The method also updates the singleton instance of the game manager.
      Parameters:
      file - the file from which the game state will be loaded
      Returns:
      the GameManager instance loaded from the specified file
      Throws:
      POOBvsZOMBIESException - if an error occurs while reading the file or deserializing the object

    • aimport

      public static void aimport(File file) throws POOBvsZOMBIESException
      Imports the game state from a specified file. The file contains details such as initial sun points, brain points, game time, and a list of zombies to initialize the game. This method sets up the game state based on the imported data and creates a new instance of the GameManager class.
      Parameters:
      file - The file containing the game state to be imported.
      Throws:
      POOBvsZOMBIESException - If an error occurs during file reading or data parsing, such as invalid format or input/output issues.

    • export

      public static void export(File file) throws POOBvsZOMBIESException
      Exports the current game state to a specified file. The game state includes details such as sun points, brain points, game time, and the list of zombies with their information.
      Parameters:
      file - The file to which the game state will be exported.
      Throws:
      POOBvsZOMBIESException - If an error occurs during file writing, such as an I/O exception.

    • removePlant

      public boolean removePlant(int row, int col)
